synsets.definition: Deep devotion expressed through caring for aging parents, encompassing emotional, physical, and financial support as a moral obligation that brings honor to the family lineage
synsets.cultural_note: Central to Confucian ethics, represents devotion that extends beyond individual relationship to ancestral and societal obligations

synsets.definition: A form of devotion characterized by the desire to be emotionally dependent on another's benevolence, allowing oneself to be vulnerable and cared for in intimate relationships
synsets.cultural_note: Uniquely Japanese concept of healthy emotional dependence that strengthens bonds through mutual vulnerability and care

synsets.definition: Deep emotional attachment and devotion that develops over time through shared experiences, creating an unbreakable bond of mutual care and loyalty
synsets.cultural_note: Korean concept representing devotion that deepens through time and shared hardship, creating family-like bonds even with non-relatives

synsets.definition: Pure, selfless devotion characterized by complete surrender and loving dedication, transcending ego boundaries in service to the beloved
synsets.cultural_note: Hindu concept of devotion that can apply to divine, human, or universal love, emphasizing selfless service and emotional surrender

synsets.definition: Unconditional maternal love and devotion that extends protective care beyond biological children to encompass nurturing dedication to all beings
synsets.cultural_note: Represents the archetypal maternal devotion in Hindu culture, seen as divine feminine principle of unconditional care

synsets.definition: Devotion expressed through extreme consideration for another's feelings, avoiding actions that might cause discomfort or burden, even at personal cost
synsets.cultural_note: Thai concept emphasizing devotion through considerate restraint and anticipating others' needs to maintain harmony

synsets.definition: Deep devotion combining passionate love with compassionate mercy, expressing care through both emotional attachment and active kindness
synsets.cultural_note: Indonesian concept blending romantic devotion with Buddhist-influenced compassion, emphasizing both feeling and virtuous action

synsets.definition: Unwavering loyalty and devotion that persists through all circumstances, maintaining commitment and care regardless of hardship or change
synsets.cultural_note: Arabic concept of devotion emphasizing constancy and reliability as expressions of deep love and honor

synsets.definition: Warm, tender devotion characterized by genuine affection and kindness, expressing love through gentle care and emotional warmth
synsets.cultural_note: Persian concept connecting devotion to the divine principle of love and kindness, emphasizing warmth and tenderness

synsets.definition: Devotion that transcends temporal boundaries, expressing love as an eternal commitment that connects past, present, and future generations
synsets.cultural_note: Jewish concept of devotion that encompasses both divine and human love as eternal, unbreakable bonds

synsets.definition: Devotion expressed through consistent caring actions that affirm the humanity and dignity of the other, recognizing their essential worth
synsets.cultural_note: Zulu concept within Ubuntu philosophy, emphasizing devotion as active care that honors human interconnectedness

synsets.definition: Deep devotion that connects lovers to spiritual forces, expressing affection as a sacred bond blessed by ancestral and divine powers
synsets.cultural_note: Yoruba concept of love as spiritual devotion connecting earthly relationships to cosmic and ancestral forces

synsets.definition: Devotion that comes from the heart center, expressing love through actions that honor the sacred nature of relationships and all connections
synsets.cultural_note: Lakota concept emphasizing devotion as heart-centered care that honors the sacred nature of all relationships

synsets.definition: Quiet, deep devotion expressed through patient presence and inner listening, offering the gift of undivided attention and spiritual awareness
synsets.cultural_note: Aboriginal Australian concept of devotion through deep, quiet presence and spiritual listening

synsets.definition: Bittersweet devotion that encompasses both presence and absence, expressing deep love through longing that transcends physical separation
synsets.cultural_note: Portuguese/Brazilian concept of devotion that finds beauty in longing and separation as expressions of deep love

synsets.definition: Warm, affectionate devotion expressed through gentle touch, kind words, and nurturing actions that create emotional safety and belonging
synsets.cultural_note: Mexican concept emphasizing devotion through tenderness and emotional nurturing within family and close relationships

synsets.definition: Pure devotion without conditions or expectations, expressing love as a gift freely given regardless of reciprocation or circumstance
synsets.cultural_note: Swahili concept of love as unconditional gift, influenced by both traditional African values and Christian teachings

synsets.definition: Devotion rooted in compassion that seeks to alleviate suffering and bring happiness to the beloved, transcending personal attachment
synsets.cultural_note: Tibetan Buddhist concept of devotion as compassionate care that transcends ego-attachment while maintaining deep caring

synsets.definition: Devoted care characterized by deep empathy and genuine concern, expressing love through understanding and actively helping with others' struggles
synsets.cultural_note: Filipino concept emphasizing devotion through empathetic understanding and active concern for others' wellbeing

synsets.definition: Deep, sincere devotion that flows from the heart without artifice, expressing genuine affection through authentic emotional connection
synsets.cultural_note: Turkish concept distinguishing genuine heart-based devotion from mere passion or superficial affection

synsets.definition: Tender devotion that cherishes and protects the beloved like a precious treasure, expressing care through gentle preservation of their wellbeing
synsets.cultural_note: Mongolian concept of devotion as precious care, reflecting nomadic values of protecting what is most valuable

synsets.definition: Devotion expressed through willing service and desire to please, combining affection with active choice to prioritize the beloved's needs
synsets.cultural_note: Quechua concept linking devotion to will and desire, emphasizing love as conscious choice to serve and please

synsets.definition: Devotion that shares life force and spiritual energy, expressing love through the generous giving of one's vital essence to nurture another
synsets.cultural_note: Māori concept of love as sharing spiritual life force, connecting devotion to ancestral power and cosmic energy

synsets.definition: Deep devotion that connects souls across time and space, expressing love as spiritual bond that transcends physical existence
synsets.cultural_note: Armenian concept emphasizing devotion as soul-connection that persists beyond physical limitations and temporal boundaries

synsets.definition: Profound devotion that creates unbreakable emotional and spiritual bonds, expressing love through loyal attachment that endures all challenges
synsets.cultural_note: Georgian concept of devotion as creating permanent bonds that survive historical upheavals and cultural challenges
